fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Sport, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
Full Circle takes up and creates discussions around topical, meaningful, society-relevant issues. It does not operate in terms of specific policies or legislative lines.  
 
Examples of subjects we have recently addressed in our activities are: Economic policy, migration policy, gender policy, education policy
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: Full Circle’s mission is to bring new and forward looking ideas and perspectives, to inform decision making at the European, national and local level – as well as at the individual level. We aim to open up debate, to include a broader range of views and input from stakeholders, as well as creating opportunities to reflect on and challenge these ideas and views.
relevant_communication:
Full Circle organizes several different types of events, where different issues are debated, open to different audiences: These include events for professionals, social /entertainment events and events for younger audiences. 
 
Examples of events for EU officials are: talks by our speakers inside the EC and EEAS, European Council, or at other locations - but open to EU officials and the public.
